metadata.synopsis: Elderly, angling and contentious friends Max (Walter Matthau) and John (Jack Lemmon) back-burner their bickering when their kids (Kevin Pollak, Daryl Hannah) get engaged, but fishing season opens a can of romantic worms as newcomer Maria (Sophia Loren) plans to turn their beloved bait shop into a restaurant. Botched matchmaking leads to some major romantic mix-ups, until an unexpected death in the family helps everyone realize that the most important thing in life is love.

reviews: Insults and sexual innuendo dominate routine comedy sequel.
Moderately successful sequel. Lemmon and Matthau always a great team to watch.
Not as good as the first, but it's seldom less than amusing.
Nowhere near as funny as the first film. Just a stale, tired rehash.
The heart of the first one is replaced by extra fart jokes.
A wheezier replay of the 1993 hit geezer romp Grumpy Old Men.
This is, of course, a big-screen sitcom, and in fact I would love to see this material transplanted to the TV screen, where it belongs.
